Kata Sri Mulyani Utang RI Tak Ekstrem Seperti Jepang dan Singapura
04 Nov 2019, 09:34 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Andhika Akbarayansyah

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa rasio utang pemerintah terhadap produk domestik bruto (PDB) masih di level aman dan tidak seekstrem negara-negara maju seperti Jepang dan Singapura.Sri Mulyani bilang, rasio utang Pemerintah berasa di level 30% terhadap PDB. Sedangkan Jepang mencapai 200% dan Singapura mencapai 123% terhadap PDB negaranya masing-masing."Indonesia masih memiliki tingkat rasio utang 30% terhadap PDB, dibandingkan banyak negara lain terutama negara negara maju atau negara tidak maju itu rasio 30% termasuk rasio cukup baik dan rendah," kata Sri Mulyani di ruang rapat Komisi XI DPR, Jakarya, Senin (4/11/2019).Sri Mulyani menceritakan, Pemerintah bisa menjaga rasio utang terhadap PDB lantaran tetap konsisten menerapkan prinsip kehati-hatian dalam mengelola defisit anggaran yang setiap tahunnya tercantum dalam APBN."Kita hadapi defisit yang besar, kadang-kadang bisa kita turunkan dan primary balance juga kita kendalikan agar APBN dalam kondisi suistanable, rasio utang ini akan kita jaga agar Indonesia mampu menjaga reputasi dan sustainibilitas dari APBN," jelas dia."Kalau dilihat level rasio kita dibandingkan Filipina dan negara advance yang bahkan mencapai 100% rasionya terhadap GDP, ekstremnya seperti Jepang bisa mencapai 200%, 113% seperti Singapura, dan negara Malaysia sekalipun juga mengalami rasio utang di atas 50% dari ekonominya," tambahnya.Mantan Direktur Pelaksana Bank Dunia ini juga mengungkapkan bahwa Pemerintah akan tetap menerapkan pengelolaan pembiayaan pada tahun 2020 tetap pada prinsip kehati-hatian. Meskipun ada pelebaran rasio defisit anggaran dari yang dipasang pada APBN."Arah kebijakan pembiayaan utang tahun 2020 sesuai desain APBN kita, kita tetap menjaga prinsip kehati-hatian, kita tetap jaga agar efisiensi biaya utang tetap bisa dikendalikan sesuai tren secara internasional dan advantage ekonomi kita sendiri," ungkap dia.Dapat diketahui, total utang pemerintah per Agustus 2019 tercatat sebesar Rp 4.680,19 triliun, bandingkan dengan Juli 2019 sebesar Rp 4.603 triliun. Utang itu tercatat naik sekitar secara bulanan Rp 77,19 triliun. Sedangkan jika dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun lalu naik Rp 317 triliun.Simak Video "Sri Mulyani Lanjut Jadi Menteri Keuangan RI"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hek/ang)

Sri Mulyani Says RI's Debt is Not as Extreme as Japan and Singapore
Nov 04 2019, 09:34 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Andhika Akbarayansyah

Jakarta - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed that the ratio of government debt to gross domestic product (GDP) is still at a safe level and is not as extreme as developed countries such as Japan and Singapore. Sri Mulyani said, the Government debt ratio was at the level of 30% to GDP. While Japan reached 200% and Singapore reached 123% of the GDP of each country. "Indonesia still has a debt ratio of 30% to GDP, compared to many other countries, especially developed or underdeveloped countries, the 30% ratio is quite good and "Sri Mulyani said in the House of Representatives Commission XI meeting room, Jakarya, Monday (11/04/2019). Sri Mulyani said, the Government could maintain the debt to GDP ratio because it remained consistent in applying the precautionary principle in managing the budget deficit every year stated in the State Budget. "We face a large deficit, sometimes we can reduce it and we also control the primary balance so that the State Budget is in a state of sufficiency, this debt ratio will be maintained so that Indonesia is able to maintain the reputation and sustainability of the State Budget," he explained. If we look at our ratio level compared to the Philippines and advanced countries which even reach 100% of their ratio to GDP, extremes like Japan can reach 200%, 113%, like Singapore, and Malaysia, even though they have a debt ratio of above 50% of their economy, "he added. The former Managing Director of the World Bank also revealed that the Government will continue to implement financing management in 2020 following the precautionary principle. Although there is a widening of the budget deficit ratio than that installed in the state budget. "The direction of the debt financing policy of 2020 is in accordance with the design of our state budget, we still maintain the precautionary principle, we continue to keep the efficiency of debt costs can be controlled according to international trends and our economic advantages itself, "he said. It can be known, the total government debt per August 2019 was recorded at Rp 4,680.19 trillion, compared with July 2019 of Rp 4,603 trillion. The debt was recorded to increase around Rp 77.19 trillion monthly. Meanwhile, if compared to the same period last year it rose Rp 317 trillion.
